website_summaries.verdict: A great design at a decent price, although you may have some mounting problems with it based on the way that it is shipped.
pros: The tread design and square shoulders help to increase traction without destroying grass and turf
Great look, and tire rides well
cons: Tires ship collapsed, which can lead to mounting problems
This tire does not come pre-mounted to a wheel

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere poor quality pkg damaged.
customer_reviews.text: This tire came w so misshapened that it was triangular with the center of the tire caved in. It looks more like a pulley It made it challenging to get on the rim. when on there were large gaps making it impossible to fill with air to form bead. Even used the ratchet strap method that usually drives the sides to the edge. They come w a mailing label on the tire probably sits w boxes and or tires piled on top A waste of a few hour messing with this and now returning it. Then more delay w mowing.
customer_reviews.author: dmann

customer_reviews.title: Use of tubes makes it easy
customer_reviews.text: Tires came smashed for shipping purposes. It’s to be expected with stuff like this. I expected this and prepared for it. I bought tubes (yes, they’re a tubeless tire) and laid the tires out in the sun for a couple days. I mounted these at home without the use of an air compressor, only a small cigarette outlet operated air pump, hence the tubes. Tires mounted up and headed up beautifully with the tubes. Been great on my mower so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Out of shape tires.
customer_reviews.text: Two tires ordered Dec 12th to receive 14th - showed up 17th evening. Needed for tractor to plow did not happen. Both tires were rapped destroying their shape note picture. Two triangle tires - wonderful! Any ideas as to reshape these rediculous triangled tires for use???? Four stars one for right address one for right size tires and one good quality, one for Understanding its common smaller tires are usually deformed when stacked and rapped. Took 180 lbs truck inflater to get then to seal. Common I found out.
customer_reviews.author: marvin huchzermeier

customer_reviews.title: Its gonna be a fight but you can get this to work
customer_reviews.text: You are gonna need to have a compressor goin. Gonna need cargo strap on it and you gotta use starting fluid all at the same time. Total pain in the butt. But you will eventually get it. And when its on it looks pretty nice compared to paying double the price for one at tractor supply. The tires come strapped together and are warped real bad. But you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Good Tires... But...
customer_reviews.text: Good tires. Read some of the previous reviews, and saw they didn't come with rims, and to get inner tubes, as the "tubeless" part of the tire didn't work to great, so I bought some inner tubes nd kept the old rims, and that worked fine. Like I said, great tires, but the shipping quality leaves something to be desired. The tires were taped together with a shipping label stuck on the front. Not necessarily what I had in mind for packaging. Buy inner tubes. You'll need them, because the "tubeless" doesn't work. Takes a while to figure out how to get them on right, so be ready to spend a couple hours on them.
customer_reviews.author: grdealwncr

customer_reviews.title: Nice lawn tractor tires !
customer_reviews.text: These are very decent replacement tires ! Have purchased this brand before from this seller for other tractors I have had and have always been pleased . The tread design is good and the price is GREAT ! These are inexpensive but they hold air,mount easily and hold up well .Have installed some in the past that were still usable 6 years later. My stuff is stored inside but it is used regularly . Would purchase again and use this vendor .
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Delivery Squish
customer_reviews.text: Tires are the right size and they appear to be of decent build but the way they are shipped makes them unuseable. Usually Amazon over packages items but i literally had two tires compressed together sitting at my door. As you can see in one photo it has a triangular shape compared to the original (not helpful). The 6" width is also compressed to about 3" which is preventing me from getting a bead seal; I'm going to have to man up and take it to a tire shop to get it seated and inflated (no amount of acetylene is going to set this)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Tire caught fire
customer_reviews.text: These tires came banded so tight and appeared to have been stored with something heavy on top. They were mounted but the shop could not inflate them by banding them and other means. (I still had to pay). I now have 2 smashed tires, hopelessly flat mounted on rims and a lawn tractor that is unusable. Found another place to inflate the tire, he used starting fluid rather than WD40 like the other places. The first 2 tries didn't work... the third try he really sprayed it down, threw a match and it mounted but the tire caught fire. I hope the tire isn't ruined
customer_reviews.author: Satchmo

customer_reviews.title: 4 ply tire,good price.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tire.I cut 2 pieces of 2x4 about 7-8 inches long and placed them inside the tire spreading the bead apart and set it in the sun for a couple hours.Remove the valve core and using just the air hose end.No need for an air chuck.Just press the female end of the hose end over the valve stem and push down.Once it seats insert core and inflate normally. get maximum
customer_reviews.author: tod black

customer_reviews.title: Need to have put on the rim
customer_reviews.text: The product literally arrived in the mail wrapped in plastic with a shipping sticker which I wasn’t impressed by. I didn’t realize that this wasn’t a full tire and that I would have to take to a tire place to get put on the rim but after we did that (it was only $15 to have done) the tire has been working great as a replacement for our lawnmower tire. When all was said and done we probably could have just had our old one repaired locally but if you know the facts ahead of time this is a great tire for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dmn6355

customer_reviews.title: Fit fine and work great
customer_reviews.text: They ship and arrive totally crushed and out of round. This condition makes them very hard to inflate and get the bead seated on the rim. If you have the time, inflate an old tube inside them and set them in the sun for a while to get warm and soft and take a new shape. Bring them in out of the heat and let them cool. When you remove the inflated tube when cool they will have a normal tire shape again. Now the installation of the tire on the rim and subsequent inflation is much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Len Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Dont return if misshapen
customer_reviews.text: Tire was severely deformed upon arrival which seemed to be a common problem. I stood on it and was able to reform it enough to mount it. Not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: good tires but !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: sometimes tires are shipped squished, which is not helpful when putting the tire on the rim. so to avoid this, I inflate the tube in the tire to swell out the beads. leave it over night or longer if you can, then let the air out and install the tire as normal. it really helps.
customer_reviews.author: T M MOORE

customer_reviews.title: Great price works fine. How to mount.
customer_reviews.text: As stated the tire came smashed probably right out of a container. But for the price I gave it a try. I have always used a ratchet strap to squeeze a tire to create a tight seal on a rim then fill it with air. Not so with a smashed tire but I rapped the tire with a semi ridged mat then squeezed it with a ratchet strap and worked first try. The inflated tire shows no signs of being smashed and works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: What gives

customer_reviews.title: Misshapen, impossible to mount at home
customer_reviews.text: As stated by other reviewers , these are impossible to mount due the them being so misshapen. They came strapped flat, and I tried every method to seal the bead - ratchet strap, igniting carb cleaner, sealing one side with a buck. I had to take them to a tire shop that was only able to mounts them with a cheetah device after 20 minutes of trying
customer_reviews.author: Zomaro

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time or money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve have replaced several hundred tires on lawn mowers tractors over the years thought I would save money and get this one it was such a pain in the butt to get it on the rim and it took two ratchet straps a couple of busted knuckles a few bad words to get it finally mounted on rim if you want to fight and fight with this product and get very frustrated than this product is for you how ever I will never buy this product again i do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: very difficult to seat
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem getting these tires to get the bead to meet the rim. They come all scrunched up and I had to use a ratchet strap to force the sidewalls to the rim and even then it was a lot of work and swearing. The tires themselves seem very good for the money but be aware you are going to have to work hard to get them to seat...but it can be done.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice tire, challenging to mount yourself without the tools.
customer_reviews.text: This was not fun to install. After muscling the old one off and the new one on I was presented with the challenge of seating the bead. I only have a small compressor and car tire inflators so this was a challenge. Ultimately I used a bit of starting fluid inside the tire with a well placed flame like I've seen on videos. To my surprise, it worked perfectly. I'm thinking about breaking the bead just to reseat it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Z.

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping, exactly as described and best value!! BUT small tires are challenging to inflate :-)
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what was described arrived promptly and in excellent condition. Good supplier!! if you mount these small tires by yourself it helps to use straps at the furthest outside edge of the tread to compress the rim area so as to inflate. They can be VERY challenging to inflate! Rachet straps along the outermost tread area do help a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Bob-O

customer_reviews.title: It's a tire ... what more can I say.
customer_reviews.text: It's a tire .... just be prepared if you're going to mount these yourself. I had to use the old exploding ether trick to get it to bead up. The tires were taped up pretty tightly and it had compressed then enough to make beading them a challenge. I holds air what more can you ask.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good tire
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I really have isn't a problem with the tire, but shipping. They come strapped tight so the tire is essentially folded in on itself. Pretty much have to use a tube just to seat bead. Otherwise Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: Here's the trick to work with a deformed tire.
customer_reviews.text: It was deformed from manufacturer's shipping as noted by other reviewers. My solution was to rig it up overnight in a stretched position. I used two clamps, 4 crossed pieces of scrap metal, a ratchet strap and an anchor point An inflated inner tube would work even better. Please refer to pictures, before during and after.
customer_reviews.author: 38/athletic

customer_reviews.title: wow that was fun
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because they were low price I had to take a heat gun to warm them up so they would flex enough so I could inflate if you have a nice hot sunny day you might be able to leave them out for a few hours but it was 50 so I didn't have that opt once I got them inflated they work great but it was a bear to put them on with only hand tools
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Lawn Mower Tires
customer_reviews.text: Good product at a good price. Put these on the rear of my mower and been mowing with no problems. I recommend these to any one needing tires.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Inflating tires after shipment !
customer_reviews.text: I really like the tires but the shipping was a mess. Both tires were in twisted balls! I had a very hard time mounting these tires even after I put qt. can inside the beads to strea.ch them back to size. Surely there is a better way to ship them!!
customer_reviews.author: widdowson1

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I have seen a lot of people complaining about the difficulty of installing theses tires and it can be challenging but there are always options to buy a tire and wheel combo if you want. Use your brain and save some money by doing it yourself. No one said it would be easy.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Easy mounting!
customer_reviews.text: No problems with mounting and bead seating. As with all small tires that I’ve mounted, I inserted four 6” wood spacers between the beads and left them in the sun for a week. Makes bead seating easier. Did not have to use a strap around the tire to seat beads.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good value takes a little work to mount
customer_reviews.text: My tire came Slightly deformed it does take some work to get it mounted the hardest part is to get the Bead to set The Ratchet straps one side at a time and try to push the tire over closer to The rim Put 120 psi and I got it to set
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Total Waste
customer_reviews.text: Tires not worth the trouble. After paying for the tires and $20 for mounting both tires won't hold air. a pinhole was found in one and plugged but it still won't hold air. close to $65.00 invested so far and I have two flats. T send them back I would have to take them off the rims ( another $20.00 ) send them back, have new ones mounted ( another $20.00 ) then I would have paid close to $100.00 for two tires . and there would be no guarantee that the new ones would hold air. Toal waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Marie Carr

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This tire is a good value. I planned to purchase a new tire locally but they were two or three times more expensive. Was easy to mount and inflate to get my mower deck back in service.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon K. Byerly

customer_reviews.title: Bad buy
customer_reviews.text: Terrible tire condition as recieved, smashed Tried to inflate tries and so smashed had to leave in sun for hours to heat up. Step on smashed , folded tires to try to widen tire enough to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Jorn Beam

customer_reviews.title: Met Minimal Expectations
customer_reviews.text: The tires arrived strapped and banded in a distorted, compressed configuration. This made mounting and inflation very difficult. One of the two was so bad that 3 professional tire shops couldn't get it to inflate. The 3rd shop capitulated the endeavor by inserting an inner tube.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This product looks like it is a better quality than the original tire on my Craftsman mower. It was fairly easy to get on the rim. It was difficult to inflate. Once the tire was on the rim I put a ratcheting strap around the center of the tire and tightened it up a little. I had a little trouble because there wasn't using enough pressure from my compressor. I turned up the pressure on my craftsman 6 gallon compressor to about 125psi and it popped right into place.
customer_reviews.author: Julius Aucoin

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a flat tire on our riding mower. We kept loosing air in the old tire so I purchased this to replace the old one. So far it has worked great...it has worked
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for Troy Blitz Bronco
customer_reviews.text: Tires came compressed,but took it to a local tire shop and were able to install these tires without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: R.Higa

customer_reviews.title: Great price!!
customer_reviews.text: This tire is a great value. The problem is they come deformed and are very difficult to get on the rim.
customer_reviews.author: Bookie_Monster

customer_reviews.title: I'm missing leg hair
customer_reviews.text: Great tire, but like everyone else mine came severely deformed. Solution, butane and a lighter. Worked like a charm, but I also gave myself an inadvertant leg shave...
customer_reviews.author: Kris Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Highly deformed
customer_reviews.text: These arrived so deformed I needed 2 ratchet straps on each tire to compress it enough to seat the bead. Really needed some starter fluid and a match but I'm leary about that method
customer_reviews.author: 10thmountainman

customer_reviews.title: BELIEVE THE BAD REVIEWS!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't the bad reviews. . Received the tires and they were deformed on arrival. I thought I could make it work. Could not... wasted an afternoon. For those of you who have given higher ratings, please tell me how you were able to install these tires ? You get what you pay for. If you buy these tires...you WILL regret it. Amazon should be ashamed for offering a product this bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit for my husqavarna 46 tractor
customer_reviews.text: Like everybody else said, need a lot of air to install yourself... I took mine down to the local auto shop and they installed them both for $8. Was better than trying to blow them up with my little compressor
customer_reviews.author: Benny D.

customer_reviews.title: Good all terrain turf friendly tire
customer_reviews.text: These went on the front of my Murray Explorer. The rear of the kart has tires meant to murder turf, and I wanted the fronts to be more turf friendly but also have reasonable traction. Since the fronts only steer and take abuse, I needed something reliable with plenty of sidewall to absorb impacts. I’ve put them through their paces with no punctures, bubbles, or other issues on multiple terrain environments.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Good if you old like us 67 and brooke and you have to do everything your self
customer_reviews.text: Tires are fine! But the car tire place could not mount them on rims. They were worry that the tire might brake. How ever, the local loan mower service gentleman installed them for me.
customer_reviews.author: JR.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend buying the tire with the rim already on it
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to inflate once we finally got the tire onto the rim because the shape of the tire when received....It looked squished. My husband said if he had to do it again he would have just bought a new rim with the tire in it. He has changed MANY tires so he knows what he’s doing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: not received as a nice round tire ore of a triangle
customer_reviews.text: Tires arrived very misshapen and could not get fire bead to seat in rim on one of the tires Seemed to be good quality but poor shipping and storage led to less than stellar performance
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THESE TIRES —it s gonna cost you more money and aggravation!!
customer_reviews.text: Tires arrived misshapened. They should not have even been shipped!! If you buys these tires know you will spend extra on tubes because they won’t properly fit to inflate and seal. Even the professionals I went to said there is no way to properly mount and inflate without a tube BECAUSE OF HOW THEY ARE SHIPPED AND DEFORMED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jabba

customer_reviews.title: Good tires
customer_reviews.text: Wished they weren’t mashed so flat, had to use inner tubes to air them up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: These tires showed up so out of shape that still haven't been able to seat the bead. I have all of the equipment. I have replaced hundred of tires. These tires are by far the worst set of tires I have ever purchased. I own a bead seating air tank that won't seat the bead. I tried ether and a ratchet strap. I also tried the bead seating air tank and ratchet strap all at the same time still couldn't seat the bead.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good deal! tires will be compressed when you receive ...
customer_reviews.text: Good deal! tires will be compressed when you receive them. installation was easy inflating them was another story. Look for videos on youtube for help with inflation.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good tire, but very difficult to mount on the Wheel. tough for the do-it-yourselfer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: TracGard Tire
customer_reviews.text: Husband needed a new tire for trailer. He was very well pleased with quality of tire.
customer_reviews.author: Mama C

customer_reviews.title: A great investment even hours later.
customer_reviews.text: These tires have about 5 hours on them right now. They have been driven over glass and barbed wire. They are still holding air and look as good as new. I trust these tires.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Better than originals.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to replace the originals on my Cub Cadet Lawn Tractor. Mounting was a bit difficult but doable. I found that heating them made them much more pliable. The tires themselves are 4ply and of very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: I will purchase two more tires for the other tractor.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector 1

customer_reviews.title: shipping
customer_reviews.text: need to figure out not to use zip tie to tie these together when shipping two tires makes it hard to inflate
customer_reviews.author: sam691

customer_reviews.title: Tire
customer_reviews.text: I bought the tire because I thought it came with a rim but overall the tires look quality easy to put on overall super satisfied
customer_reviews.author: efrain soto

customer_reviews.title: ARRIVED DAMAGED
customer_reviews.text: THESE TIRES ARRIVED DAMAGED AND NOT MOUNTABLE. A BETTER OPTION IS TO PURCHASE TIRES MOUNTED ON WHEELS.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Not a  good buy
customer_reviews.text: Not a good buy even they say let it seat for awhile after opening the rap but still you will be lucky if you got it installed
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: best to have it installed
customer_reviews.text: cost 4 bucks to have it installed and from past experience it would have taken me at least an hour with hand tools. good traction and it's keeping air, can't ask for more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Ironbutt

customer_reviews.title: Works on my TryBilt super bronco.
customer_reviews.text: More convenient than changing tires and not much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: valkyrie

customer_reviews.title: Rim not included
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read very far into it I thought it came with the rim. But it was just a tire and I had a heck of a time putting it on the rim and getting it to hold air. After a couple of DIY videos they're Seated on the rim and they look and work great.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Harris

customer_reviews.title: They come flat but I don't Care
customer_reviews.text: These are the best tires what I do I spray starting fluid in the rim a little squirt them I torch my tires to get them to seal
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Does not leak
customer_reviews.text: Best small lawn tire I have ever bought, does not leak down like the rest
customer_reviews.author: rex hinshaw

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be a quality tire
customer_reviews.text: Arrived, on time, and looks great on my garden tractor.
customer_reviews.author: Jayebee

customer_reviews.title: hard to seat on rims
customer_reviews.text: they come concaved in the middle hard to air them up and seat them on rims
customer_reviews.author: Jan Wilson

customer_reviews.title: a+++++
customer_reviews.text: was an error but customer service took care of it wonderfully
customer_reviews.author: LARRY GROVES

customer_reviews.title: Needs inner tubes!
customer_reviews.text: They will not install without inner tubes. Too deformed to get an air seal.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Piatek

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty sidewalks
customer_reviews.text: They are heavy wall tires I used either to inflate
customer_reviews.author: Richard Williams

customer_reviews.title: No rims
customer_reviews.text: I though it would come with the rims since the picture had them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: tracGard Tires
customer_reviews.text: Tires seem to be good quality. Shipping method crushes tires and the end user must install an inner tube to be able to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Work very well. I used tubes as I never trust the seal on any of these tires. Look great too!
customer_reviews.author: Karl F

customer_reviews.title: Price is right.  Quality is right.
customer_reviews.text: These are the tires to buy for your riding mower.
customer_reviews.author: James Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Nice tire for the money! They are devil, however to change and inflate. Unless you’re a DIY, have a tire store change it.
customer_reviews.author: John Jones

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive advertising, No rim only rubber tires!
customer_reviews.text: Deceptive advertising they don’t ship the rim with the tire!!!
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Tires are Okay, but packaging, or lack there of is a problem
customer_reviews.text: Tires a a good value for the price, the come so badly compressed and out of round that they’re nearly impossible to mount.
customer_reviews.author: Mattloaf

customer_reviews.title: Squished on delivery
customer_reviews.text: You better know how to use ether or some other flammable to get the beads to set! These were more squished than 50 clowns in a VW bug!
customer_reviews.author: John Pac

customer_reviews.title: Thicker tires than I was hoping for, A+
customer_reviews.text: I saw the reviews of people saying they came misshapen because of straps. Well, they must have fixed that problem. These came perfect and they are thicker than the ones on my mower.
customer_reviews.author: Emdk

customer_reviews.title: Easier to Install than the Larger Tires
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these 15x6x6 tires and a set of 20x10x8 tires. Installing the smaller (15x6x6) tires was much easier than the larger set because the sidewalls on the larger tires would not seat on the rim due to deformed (concaved) sidewalls. These smaller tires were much easier to install, seal, and inflate.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Nice tires ,there a little hard to put on ,time consuming, but once there on they seal and fit well.
customer_reviews.author: mark spalding

customer_reviews.title: Fit
customer_reviews.text: My Cub Cadet Tractor. They are awesome. We mounted them to the rims ourselves.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mac

customer_reviews.title: New grip
customer_reviews.text: Tires come packaged together so they are flattened,sit them in Sun to help reshape will help with install
customer_reviews.author: tw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Yes, they were sort of dented with the packing strap, but my husband left them outside for the day in the sun and they softened right up. He put them on his go-kart without a problem and he is thrilled with the bargin he got. Hasn't drove the kart yet, if there is a problem, I'll add to so, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Janet B

customer_reviews.title: Hard to mount
customer_reviews.text: Had to use ratchet straps to mount. They were strapped together which warped them terribly. Are well made tires though. Mower drives great with them.
customer_reviews.author: Dean B Booen

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: Packaged very tightly. Very difficult to install. Would highly recommend that future orders include a new rim
customer_reviews.author: OT

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2 tires... both had pin size holes!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 tires... and both of them had pin size holes causing very slow leaks. Has to be deliberate to have multiple small holes like that. Won't purchase tires off of Amazon again!
customer_reviews.author: jB

customer_reviews.title: Other reviews are correct, the way they package these for shipping crushes the tires
customer_reviews.text: Tires themselves seem pretty good. Very difficult to get on rims. Definitely remove valve and connect compressor hose directly to get tires to inflate and seat bead
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only got one tire, paid and ordered 2 no way to get refund
customer_reviews.text: Only received one tire , can’t get refund for missing tire
customer_reviews.author: bs

customer_reviews.title: Seat bead with starting fluid
customer_reviews.text: Good tires just use starting fluid to seat the bead see video
customer_reviews.author: richard r

customer_reviews.title: Scca hop around.
customer_reviews.text: Did not like the picture of tire with rim. Will cost another 30 dollars to get them mounted on your old rims. There is a one line statement at end that they do not come with rims.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Poor product in my eyes
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered very out of shape and unable to make the tire seal to rim. Poor product in my eyes!
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: These tires arrived so distorted and pancaked that even local tire professionals could not mount them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Barkdull

customer_reviews.title: Tires only - not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Made an incorrect assumption that wheels came with the tires. Not so. Tires are nice. Just no wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Burl W.

customer_reviews.title: Worst tires ever
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to put these triangle tires on a round rim with no luck. I have been at it all day and I still haven’t gotten the tires to take air.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Awesomely Happy
customer_reviews.text: Price was good; shipping was amazingly fast, especially during the Covid Shutdown (4 days to Alaska no extra charge!); and best of all, the tires (4ply, 15x6.00-6) were top quality, and worked Perfectly. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Prosper

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Severely deformed. I have tried everything short of baking them to get them back to shape. Will not seat on the rim.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you want to be mad
customer_reviews.text: these tires came all smashed and no matter how hard we try we can’t get them on the rims because they are so smashed they won’t inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela

customer_reviews.title: tires
customer_reviews.text: good tires. Go kart runs great with these awesome tires!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Soto

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good tire at good price. Was not crushed to ship.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen

customer_reviews.title: This tire does not have a rim as displayed.
customer_reviews.text: I expected to receive a mounted tire as in the picture. Other tires showed tires not mounted or mounted. It is deceptive advertising. If it doesn.t include a rim, show it with the other tires of the same.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: easy way to install
customer_reviews.text: tire arrived a little squished and the rubber was hard . we warmed the tire by our wood stove and it went on easy , you could put the tire in the oven and warm it to make it flexible . hope this helps .
customer_reviews.author: ira teel

customer_reviews.title: How great they look and work
customer_reviews.text: AAA+++ these tires supprised the heck out of me. How great they look and work, did not think this good of a deal was out there! Nothing there to dislike...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: TracGard N766 Turf Bias Tire - 15X600-6
product_meta.description: TracGard tires are built tough, to endure a variety of work and play environments. TracGard is a registered trademark of TIRECO, Inc., a specialty tire distributor with over 40 years of experience in the specialty product industry. The OEM quality products have been used by North America’s largest and most respected equipment manufacturers, and continue to be demanded by today’s informed consumers. All TracGard are built for strength, endurance, and reliability. TracGard speciality tires are the choice of seasoned professionals and weekend warriors when preparing to tackle the outdoors.
feature_bullets: Extensive fitment range for today's most popular specialty equipment
All purpose tread design makes the N766 versatile-both on and off pavement and turf
Heavy duty 4 P.R.rating helps resist punctures, extends service time, and carries heavier loads
Excellent for both commercial and residential use. Max Load 570@30
